comments:
I am using Build id: 200405211200.

I have written a multi page editor plug-in that allows save as capabilities.
However, since M9, I have been running into problems saving the multi page
editor files. 
I am not sure if I have made any changes that could have affected the described
operation, but I do not believe so. Let me know if you need access to the code.

I saw the following in the console:
"Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/Temp2"

Here is the content of the log file:

!STACK 0

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:622)

The problem is in FileDocumentProvider.

getSaveRule uses a "create file" scheduling rule. Inside the implementation of
doSaveDocument, it sometimes creates parent folders as well (using
ContainerGenerator). The getSaveRule method must return the correct rule
required by the save operation.

I tried this again implementing "FormEditor" versus implementing
"MultiPageEditorPart" directly. The latter worked correctly for the "File->Save
As" operation. 
Could this be a "Forms" issue as well?

Oh, I also forgot to mention my editor class is an instance of
"org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextEditor".
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 60795 ***

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/Temp2
